item.title: New Road marking, 4th October
item.description:
Swindon Lane junction with racecourse roundabout has 2 lanes. Left lane is marked straight on and left, the right lane is marked straight on with no right arrow. The 2 lanes indicating straight on pose a potential problem when 2 vehicles attempt to go straight over into New Barn Lane which has only 1 entry lane. I have already experienced this but no collision occurred ! I believe the original road markings at the junction were left lane, left turn only with right lane straight on and right turn - all very clear & easy to follow. Suggest these markings are reinstated to avoid future problems.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Marle Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: General road marking and stud issues

item.title: The vacuum tanker team worked on several drains in Royal Well Lane on 2nd October. On 3rd of October 3 out of 6 drains I looked at were still blocked. I measured the levels of all 7. 4 drains were 40+ inches to the water level, 1 at 25 inches, 1 at 17 inches and 1 at 11 inches. Today's observations show minimal change if any. Well and truly blocked I think. Vacuum Tanker not able to lift compacted stuff? Needs high pressure or digging out?, 4th October

item.title: General road marking and stud issues problem, 4th October
item.description:
Customer wishes to raise concerns with road markings at location. States that there is a misleading Straight On arrow on the road that directs motorists into the bus lane that is not properly marked. This ha resulted in multiple ANPR PCNs issued to unaware motorists. Is requesting that a Turn Right arrow is installed to direct vehicles away from the bus lane into Gloucester Place, and that the bus lane is made more obvious.
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: General road marking and stud issues

item.title: 2 x potholes, 4th October

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 48, Hatherley Road, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: To underscore the points that you have been making about the awful condition of Daisybank Road, I am about to ask Gloucester Highways to visit for the third time in eighteen months to repair the road outside our property (Underscar, Daisybank Road, GL53 9QQ). The condition of this section of the public highway is so poor that it is nearly impossible for some vehicles to enter or leave our property without incurring damage, 4th October
item.description:
This road needs a proper overhaul & resurface rather than a "temporary" pothole repair - this is the third time in eighteen months that I have asked for a repair to the road outside our property (Underscar, Daisybank Road, GL53 9QQ). The condition of this section of the public highway is so poor that it is nearly impossible for some vehicles to enter or leave our property without incurring damage - see attached photos.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Daisybank Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: General road marking and stud issues problem, 4th October
item.description:
All lining around the school have worn and drivers are ignoring them now, which is risking the safety for drivers and school pedestrians. Drivers are even mounting kerbs forcing children and parents to walk in the road to get to the school gates.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Entrance to new caravan park on blind bend, 4th October
item.description:
There is a serious traffic accident risk with a new caravan park, the entrance on a single track lane and blind bend. There has been no planning permission or public risk assessment from highways. The site is also on a flood plain and access for vehicles would be difficult if flooded.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Blacksmiths Lane, Leigh, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: General road marking and stud issues
